title: Creating Vertical Space: Custom Cedar Arbors & Trellises
intro: Custom cedar arbors and trellises add height, structure, and elegance to Chicago landscapes. They enhance curb appeal while giving climbing plants the perfect framework to grow naturally.
content:
Why Vertical Elements Matter in Landscape Design

Most landscapes focus heavily on ground-level features—patios, sod, garden beds, and walkways. But vertical elements like arbors and trellises transform a space by adding depth, height, and visual interest. In smaller Chicago yards, vertical accents also make the space feel larger and more dynamic.

Why Cedar Is the Best Material

Cedar is naturally rot-resistant, insect-resistant, and able to withstand Chicago’s seasonal temperature swings without warping. It ages beautifully, developing a soft silver-gray patina over time unless sealed.

Plant Pairings for Arbors & Trellises

Cedar structures work beautifully with climbing plants like:

• Clematis
• Climbing roses
• Hydrangea vine
• Honeysuckle
• Wisteria (for large structures)

Design Styles

Whether you prefer a sleek modern look or a more rustic garden vibe, cedar arbors can be customized with:

• Decorative lattice patterns
• Curved tops
• Integrated lighting
• Built-in benches or planters

Conclusion

A well-designed cedar arbor or trellis becomes a statement piece that elevates your entire yard.
